title: Troppi processi di Firefox aperti.
content: Salve, già quando apro firefox senza alcun link mi trovo in esplora risorse 8 processi aperti. Dopo un po' di navigazione ho il PC rallentato e trovo in esplora risorse un numero multlipo di processi rispetto al numero di schede aperte. Alcuni processi occupano anche centinaia se non migliaia di Mb. Ho provato a terminarne alcuni e molti, anche di quelli pesanti, non sono collegati a nessuna pagina aperta in quanto alla chiusura del processo non corrisponde nessuna chiusura in firefox. Domande: 1- come si fa ad evitare che si aprano un numero di processi scollegati dal numero di pagine aperte? 2- se rimangono aperti dei processi non più collegati a pagine aperte in firefox come si fa a fare pulizia prima che si rallenti il PC? Grazie per l'attenzione.
creator: carlo.fantoni

title: Open homepages when Firefox first starts, but blank page in new window
content:
Hi!

So I switched from Chrome, and there is one thing that keeps annoying me: the homepage and new window behavior.

In Chrome, you could define your pages that load when first launching the browser, but when you open a new window, it would default back to an empty page. This is the behavor that I want.

In Firefox, I only found the solution with setting the browser.startup.page option to 0, so new windows open with a blank page while you could still edit your homepages. But here, I would have to click the homepage button each time I initially start the browser. This is quite annoying, since it would always be an extra step when launching the browser.

Could anyone help me get the behavior like in Chrome? I want Firefox to open my homepages on startup, but use empty pages when it's already open.
creator: cs19122005

title: Firefox profile cache2 folder has unmovable and invisible files.
content:
I am helping someone with setting up their computer. They are on Windows 7. As part of that setup, I needed to shrink the C: partition so I could create a second partition. The C: drive is on a SATA connected SSD. After running a defragger to do that and consolidate the files to the lower half of the disk I found that there were some unmovable files very near the end of the disk that prevented the shrink. When I examined the files (via the defragger interface), they were in the Firefox profile in the Cache2 folder. But when I navigated to the profile, there was no cache2 folder.

I have run chkdsk and it fixed a few errors but the files were still unmovable and not visible in Explorer. I have enabled Hidden and System files. So how in the heck do I delete these files so I can shrink the partition?
creator: DoctorBashir

title: Firefox Browser
content:
When I use Microsoft Edge Browser in the top row it shows my Bookmarks and to the left it also shows an icon that allows you to jump back to the Edge Browser.

In Mozilla Firefox there is no icon to take you back to the Firefox browser. Occasionally a site will Hi-Jack you and trying to use the back arrow to get back to the Browser does not work. The only solution is to shut down the Firefox browser and then restart it again.

I would rather use Firefox as it support HTML 5 audio which is not supported in Microsoft Edge.

Can you please advise.

Many thanks

Les Finch

title: Hata kodu: SSL_ERROR_RX_RECORD_TOO_LONG
content:
Normal şartlarda e fatura imzalama aracını açtığımızda, bizi otomatik olarak, https://localhost:8543/

bu sayafaya atıyor ve ordan e arşiv fatura işlemlerimize devam ediyoruz. Ancak şu an sayfaya yönlendirildiğimizde bize ;

localhost:8543 bağlantısı sırasında bir hata oluştu. SSL izin verilen uzunluğu aşan bir kayıt aldı.

Hata kodu: SSL_ERROR_RX_RECORD_TOO_LONG

bu hatayı veriyor ve bu nedenle faturamızı oluşturamıyoruz. Yardımınızı rica ederim.
creator: kiymet

content:

What is causing this?

James

title: Cannot post on Blogger because a RECAPTCHA error keeps happening - firefox security settings to blame
content:
Hi - I am finding that since whatever recent damn Firefox update now i cant post on a blogger (blogspot.com) page as everytime i try to i get the same message that

"Could not connect to the reCAPTCHA service. Please check your internet connection and reload "

i reload and same thing happens. I saw a solution online that i have to allow cross-site tracking for this to work, however Firefox you dont give me the option to simply switch that off for this particular site from what i can see

so how to do fix this - will you rectify this problem with your security settings?
